definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
surname Piao/Korean surname (Park, Pak, or Bak)/also pr. [Pu2]

sentences.english: Object To identify Magnolia officinal and Campbell magnolia.
sentences.chinese: 目的對厚朴和滇藏木蘭進行鑑別。

sentences.english: Now Pinellia and Magnolia Bark Decoction has obtained a good effect on globus hystericus.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀上半夏厚朴湯對治療癔球症有較好的療效。

sentences.english: Goldman is an investor in Hopu.
sentences.chinese: 高盛是厚朴的一個投資者。

sentences.english: Objective To compare and identify certified Magnolia Officinalis species and its counterfeit species.
sentences.chinese: 目的對正品厚朴及僞品厚朴進行鑑別比較。

sentences.english: Objective To compare and identify certified Magnolia Officinalis species and its counterfeit species.
sentences.chinese: 目的對正品厚朴及僞品厚朴進行鑑別比較。

sentences.english: Three, Banxia Houpu Decoction Banxiaxiexin Decoction treatment of children with chronic gastritis.
sentences.chinese: 半夏厚朴湯合半夏瀉心湯治療小兒慢性胃炎。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effect of Houpu and Houpu processed by Ginger juice on gastrointestinal motor function.
sentences.chinese: 目的考察厚朴姜炙前後對小鼠胃排空機能的影響。

sentences.english: Native to China, the bark of Magnolia is being researched as an agent against amoebic dysentery.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，厚朴一直被用來治療阿米巴痢疾。

sentences.english: One of the active chemicals. honokiol, can cause B-cells of lymphocytic leukemia into apoptosis.
sentences.chinese: 厚朴酚能使到淋巴白學病之B細胞凋亡。

definition: bamboo shavings (Bambusa tuldoides) used in Chinese medicine
husk of betel nut 檳榔|槟榔[bing1 lang5]
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
radish seed (used in TCM to treat indigestion)
the rhizome of large-headed atractylodes (Atractylodes macrocephaia)
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
common water plantain (Alisma plantago-aquatica)/water plantain rhizome (used in TCM)
